column3: If you're going to break after the first match you must search backwards (there can be multiple outputs matching the pattern; the last one counts).

Concept NACK.  I can understand the desire for easier to read code, but this kind of refactor in consensus logic is generally not worth the review burden.  \n\nIn this case, exiting early -- a seemingly nice optimization -- would introduce a consensus bug(!).
Thanks guys, TIL. Updated to remove the early exit. Now it's strictly a refactor. Bonus comment to warn future readers.
Closing due to NACK and the loads of other code in need of consideration.
